channel.title: Creationism, or the spontaneous beginning of life?
channel.description: What do you think? Were we created by any kind of smarter, higher being? Or did we just someday appear out of nowhere?

item.title: Creationism, or the spontaneous beginning of life?
item.dc:creator: @Nashiu Nashiu
item.description:
@Nashiu wrote:

I'm a Christian and all...sorta..but I have a few questions.

It is said that God knows everything you have ever done, and everything you will do even before you do it. So why are we sinning? He knows we're going to sin, obviously, so why do we need to ask for forgiveness?

Read full topic
item.source: Creationism, or the spontaneous beginning of life?

item.title: Creationism, or the spontaneous beginning of life?
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

The reason we believe that God created the world and the universe is because it is impossible to fathom any other conclusion. The Big Bang theory is plausible, but how could it possibly be spontaneous? What was the universe before the big bang? I personally believe that the universe was created somehow by a supreme being; whether it was designed in a certain manner or a big bang did occur. I also think we're all totally ignorant on this matter and that trying to figure out how everything really started would be fruitless.

Read full topic

S!ms:

[quote author=jme_009 link=topic=1172.msg17977#msg17977 date=1145912209]
Or perhaps the universe has always just been here.

It it's stated that god has always existed, then why wouldnt the universe just have always existed?

and how was the universe there? Just from nowhere: BOOM! voilÃ¡, une universe pour les hommes? don't think so...SOMETHING must made it...

And, if you REALLY want to know who made it, follow these easy steps:

  1. Go to your local store and buy a AK47
  2. Walk outside and point it at yourself
  3. Pull the trigger and voila, u know what's after life! :D[/quote]

Then what made thing thing that made the universe? I said how do you know the universe wasnt just there FOREVER, I didnt say it poofed out of no where. Im just replacing th term "god" with "universe"

item.title: Creationism, or the spontaneous beginning of life?
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

I think humans and all other species evolved on earth millions (maybe billions) of years ago. Human beings share 25% of the same DNA with bananas, so we should get over ourselves.

If god really created humankind in his image, he must be an asshole, we've been killing eachother nonstop before Christ arrived, and after he arrived, we just started killing people under his name (the crusades, many modern wars based on religion).

Read full topic

item.source: Creationism, or the spontaneous beginning of life?

item.title: Creationism, or the spontaneous beginning of life?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Well, it's so hard to tell. You'd think people would remember, and tell each generation, I dont see how such important history just gets forgotten.

I don't believe that all of a sudden adam and eve appeared(or whatever), and I dont believe life just "started" out of no where. I think life started in the precambrian era, when organisims started to grow in the water, millions of years ago. I have a feeling this might turn into some religious battle, hopefully we wont see any of that.

edit* Just re-read my post, I kinda contridicted myself. When I say I dont think life just "started" I meant I dont think humans appeared out of nowhere.

Read full topic
